title: IndexError: index 5 is out of bounds for axis 1 with size 1
body:
I am aware that similar issues exist but none of them solves my problems.

I used a toy example:
```
X,y = shap.datasets.boston()
model = GradientBoostingRegressor()
model.fit(X,y)
explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model=model)
shap_values_explanation = explainer(X)
```
So far so good, then I tried to generate the scatter plot
```
shap.plots.scatter(shap_values_explanation[:,'RM'])
```

Error:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/ligk2e/opt/anaconda3/envs/scanpy/lib/python3.6/site-packages/IPython/core/interactiveshell.py", line 3343, in run_code
    exec(code_obj, self.user_global_ns, self.user_ns)
  File "<ipython-input-24-b2a9028afaf3>", line 1, in <module>
    shap.plots.scatter(shap_values_explanation[:,'RM'])
  File "/Users/ligk2e/opt/anaconda3/envs/scanpy/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/_explanation.py", line 297, in __getitem__
    new_self._s = self._s.__getitem__(item)
  File "/Users/ligk2e/opt/anaconda3/envs/scanpy/lib/python3.6/site-packages/slicer/slicer.py", line 112, in __getitem__
    sliced_o = tracked[slicer_index]
  File "/Users/ligk2e/opt/anaconda3/envs/scanpy/lib/python3.6/site-packages/slicer/slicer_internal.py", line 69, in __getitem__
    return UnifiedDataHandler.slice(self.o, index_tup, self.max_dim)
  File "/Users/ligk2e/opt/anaconda3/envs/scanpy/lib/python3.6/site-packages/slicer/slicer_internal.py", line 582, in slice
    is_element, sliced_o, cut = head_slice(o, index_tup, max_dim)
  File "/Users/ligk2e/opt/anaconda3/envs/scanpy/lib/python3.6/site-packages/slicer/slicer_internal.py", line 418, in head_slice
    sliced_o = o[cut_index]
IndexError: index 5 is out of bounds for axis 1 with size 1
```

It is clear that this error comes from ```slicer``` package, it shouldn't be related to matplotlib or shap version, my shap version is 0.38.1, and it is a persistent issue, I can not generate scatter plots in all my cases.

Also, I tried to understand this ```Explanation``` object, it seems like all the attributes explanations are yet to be completed( https://shap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/generated/shap.Explanation.html#shap.Explanation ), which prompted me to this issue page and try to get some hints on how to solve this problem.

Thank you,
Frank
